result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Neil Grossell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will not possess or consume alcohol.
B.  I will not enter into any bars/taverns.
C.  I will complete 200 hours of community service through the CJCC Program.  Termination from this program will be considered a violation of this agreement.

supervisions.notes: Costs/surcharges to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month combined with his prior payment plan.
Serve 60 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release and credit for good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Neil Grossell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 17R 000861 - Balance owing on PP paid in full.
Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Payment Plan Due Date Summary (combined PP)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher Neil Grossell in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 60 days in the Pepin County Jail given the circumstances he completed significant amount of  his DAGP community service.  Atty Loberg requests his report date be June 13 and get credit for good time.  Defendant addresses the Court.  Court sentences defendant to 60 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 1 day, with work release and credit for good time; pay costs, add to current payment plan; provide a DNA sample; advised of felony prohibitions.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Christopher Neil Grossell in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke DPA.  Defendant agrees agreement violated, OAR charge for coming to the courthouse outside of his hours to pay his fine.  Court finds DPA violated, agreement revoked, accept plea previously entered and find defendant guilty.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date to allow time to notify victims.
Motion hearing on April 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 200 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 10-15-15. Complete all hours by 6-15-17 with minimum of 10 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program: Probation violation; Revoke DPA.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

Defendant pleads NC.  State confirms victim rights complied with, no VIS, no restitution requested.  To OWI 1st defendant pleads NC.  Court assesses $969.00 TTP granted of $100/mo. com. 11/1/15; revoke D/L for 7 months with credit for any admin. suspension; AA/DSP; 1 yr. IID of vehicle effective 9/29/15.  Approve DPA, dismiss 15TR198, 15TR352, 15TR437.  Complete TTP.

Defendant Christopher Neil Grossell in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Loberg informs court of resolution of everything, DPA on felony, plea NC on OWI 1st >.15, other citations will be dismissed.  Counsel presents WPH, PLQ/WRF to the court.  Court advises of charge/max. penalties and rights, felony prohibitions.  Court reviews DPA with defendant.  If comply, case dismissed, if violate agrmt. could return to court to determine whether or not you violated the agrmt., agrmt. could be revoked, accept plea and proceed to sentencing.  Advised of OWI 1st @ .22 penalties.  All other cases would be dismissed.  Advised of right to preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives right to P.H., WOPH form filed with the court.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Court advises defendant of rights.
Jens H. Loberg, Loberg Law Office, has been retained by defendant, Christopher N. Grossell in the above-referenced matter....
